intro: Erythranthe glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf monkeyflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, typically orange or red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Erythranthe glabrata plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
